åœ¨ä»‹ç» service ä¹‹å‰æˆ‘å…ˆè°ƒæ•´äº†æºç ï¼š

func main() {  
   http.HandleFunc("/ping", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {  
      name, _ := os.Hostname()  
      log.Printf("%s ping", name)  
      fmt.Fprint(w, "pong")  
   })  
   http.HandleFunc("/service", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {  
      resp, err := http.Get("http://k8s-combat-service:8081/ping")  
      if err != nil {  
         log.Println(err)  
         fmt.Fprint(w, err)  
         return  
      }  
      fmt.Fprint(w, resp.Status)  
   })  
  
   http.ListenAndServe(":8081", nil)  
}

entry.title: jakzal/phpqa
entry.summary:
Docker image that provides static analysis tools for PHP

Static Analysis Tools for PHP

Docker image providing static analysis tools for PHP. The list of available tools and the installer are actually managed in the jakzal/toolbox repository.

Supported platforms and PHP versions

Docker hub repository: https://hub.docker.com/r/jakzal/phpqa/

Nightly builds: https://hub.docker.com/r/jakzal/phpqa-nightly/

Debian

  • latest, debian (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0, 1.91, 1.91.0-debian, 1.91-debian (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-php8.0, 1.91-php8.0, php8.0-debian, php8.0 (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-php8.1, 1.91-php8.1, php8.1-debian, php8.1 (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-php8.2, 1.91-php8.2, php8.2-debian, php8.2 (Dockerfile)

Alpine

  • alpine (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-alpine, 1.91-alpine, (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-php8.0-alpine, 1.91-php8.0-alpine, php8.0-alpine (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-php8.1-alpine, 1.91-php8.1-alpine, php8.1-alpine (Dockerfile)
  • 1.91.0-php8.2-alpine, 1.91-php8.2-alpine, php8.2-alpine (Dockerfile)

Legacy

These are the latest tags for PHP versions that are no longer supported:

  • 1.80.0-php7.4, 1.80-php7.4, php7.4-debian, php7.4 (Dockerfile)
  • 1.80.0-php7.4-alpine, 1.80-php7.4-alpine, php7.4-alpine (Dockerfile)
  • 1.61.2-php7.3, 1.61-php7.3, php7.3-debian, php7.3 (debian/Dockerfile)
  • 1.61.2-php7.3-alpine, 1.61-php7.3-alpine, php7.3-alpine (alpine/Dockerfile)
  • 1.44.0-php7.2, 1.44-php7.2, php7.2 (7.2/debian/Dockerfile)
  • 1.44.0-php7.2-alpine, 1.44-php7.2-alpine, php7.2-alpine (7.2/alpine/Dockerfile)
  • 1.26.0-php7.1, 1.26-php7.1, php7.1 (7.1/debian/Dockerfile)
  • 1.26.0-php7.1-alpine, 1.26-php7.1-alpine, php7.1-alpine (7.1/alpine/Dockerfile)

Available tools

Name Description PHP 8.0 PHP 8.1 PHP 8.2
behat Helps to test business expectations âœ… âœ… âœ…
box Fast, zero config application bundler with PHARs âŒ âœ… âœ…
box-3 Fast, zero config application bundler with PHARs âœ… âœ… âŒ
churn Discovers good candidates for refactoring âœ… âœ… âœ…
codeception Codeception is a BDD-styled PHP testing framework âœ… âœ… âœ…
composer Dependency Manager for PHP âœ… âœ… âœ…
composer-bin-plugin Composer plugin to install bin vendors in isolated locations âœ… âœ… âœ…
composer-normalize Composer plugin to normalize composer.json files âœ… âœ… âœ…
composer-require-checker Verify that no unknown symbols are used in the sources of a package. âŒ âœ… âœ…
composer-require-checker-3 Verify that no unknown symbols are used in the sources of a package. âœ… âœ… âœ…
composer-unused Show unused packages by scanning your code âœ… âœ… âœ…
dephpend Detect flaws in your architecture âœ… âœ… âœ…
deprecation-detector Finds usages of deprecated code âœ… âœ… âœ…
deptrac Enforces dependency rules between software layers âŒ âœ… âœ…
diffFilter Applies QA tools to run on a single pull request âœ… âœ… âœ…
ecs Sets up and runs coding standard checks âœ… âœ… âœ…
infection AST based PHP Mutation Testing Framework âŒ âœ… âœ…
larastan PHPStan extension for Laravel âœ… âœ… âœ…
local-php-security-checker Checks composer dependencies for known security vulnerabilities âœ… âœ… âœ…
parallel-lint Checks PHP file syntax âœ… âœ… âœ…
paratest Parallel testing for PHPUnit âœ… âœ… âœ…
pdepend Static Analysis Tool âœ… âœ… âœ…
pest The elegant PHP Testing Framework âœ… âœ… âœ…
phan Static Analysis Tool âœ… âœ… âœ…
phive PHAR Installation and Verification Environment âœ… âœ… âœ…
php-coupling-detector Detects code coupling issues âœ… âœ… âœ…
php-cs-fixer PHP Coding Standards Fixer âœ… âœ… âœ…
php-fuzzer A fuzzer for PHP, which can be used to find bugs in libraries by feeding them 'random' inputs âœ… âœ… âœ…
php-semver-checker Suggests a next version according to semantic versioning âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpa Checks for weak assumptions âœ… âœ… âœ…
phparkitect Helps to put architectural constraints in a PHP code base âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpat Easy to use architecture testing tool âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpbench PHP Benchmarking framework âŒ âœ… âœ…
phpca Finds usage of non-built-in extensions âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpcb PHP Code Browser âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpcbf Automatically corrects coding standard violations âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpcodesniffer-composer-install Easy installation of PHP_CodeSniffer coding standards (rulesets). âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpcov a command-line frontend for the PHP_CodeCoverage library âŒ âœ… âœ…
phpcpd Copy/Paste Detector âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpcs Detects coding standard violations âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpcs-security-audit Finds vulnerabilities and weaknesses related to security in PHP code âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpda Generates dependency graphs âœ… âŒ âŒ
phpdd Finds usage of deprecated features âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpDocumentor Documentation generator âŒ âœ… âœ…
phpinsights Analyses code quality, style, architecture and complexity âœ… âœ… âœ…
phplint Lints php files in parallel âœ… âœ… âœ…
phploc A tool for quickly measuring the size of a PHP project âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpmd A tool for finding problems in PHP code âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpmetrics Static Analysis Tool âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpmnd Helps to detect magic numbers âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpspec SpecBDD Framework âœ… âœ… âŒ
phpstan Static Analysis Tool âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-banned-code PHPStan rules for detecting calls to specific functions you don't want in your project âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-beberlei-assert PHPStan extension for beberlei/assert âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-deprecation-rules PHPStan rules for detecting deprecated code âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-doctrine Doctrine extensions for PHPStan âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-ergebnis-rules Additional rules for PHPstan âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-exception-rules PHPStan rules for checked and unchecked exceptions âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-larastan Separate installation of phpstan for larastan âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-phpunit PHPUnit extensions and rules for PHPStan âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-strict-rules Extra strict and opinionated rules for PHPStan âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-symfony Symfony extension for PHPStan âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpstan-webmozart-assert PHPStan extension for webmozart/assert âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpunit The PHP testing framework âŒ âœ… âœ…
phpunit-8 The PHP testing framework (8.x version) âœ… âœ… âœ…
phpunit-9 The PHP testing framework (9.x version) âœ… âœ… âœ…
pint Opinionated PHP code style fixer for Laravel âœ… âœ… âœ…
psalm Finds errors in PHP applications âœ… âœ… âœ…
psalm-plugin-doctrine Stubs to let Psalm understand Doctrine better âœ… âœ… âœ…
psalm-plugin-phpunit Psalm plugin for PHPUnit âœ… âœ… âœ…
psalm-plugin-symfony Psalm Plugin for Symfony âœ… âœ… âœ…
psecio-parse Scans code for potential security-related issues âœ… âœ… âœ…
rector Tool for instant code upgrades and refactoring âœ… âœ… âœ…
roave-backward-compatibility-check Tool to compare two revisions of a class API to check for BC breaks âœ… âœ… âœ…
simple-phpunit Provides utilities to report legacy tests and usage of deprecated code âœ… âœ… âœ…
twig-lint Standalone cli twig 1.X linter âœ… âœ… âœ…
twig-linter Standalone cli twig 3.X linter âœ… âœ… âœ…
twigcs The missing checkstyle for twig! âœ… âœ… âœ…
yaml-lint Compact command line utility for checking YAML file syntax âŒ âœ… âœ…

More tools

Some tools are not included in the docker image, to use them refer to their documentation:

  • exakat - a real time PHP static analyser

Removed tools

Name Summary
analyze Visualizes metrics and source code
box-legacy Legacy version of box
composer-normalize Composer plugin to normalize composer.json files
design-pattern Detects design patterns
parallel-lint Checks PHP file syntax
php-formatter Custom coding standards fixer
phpcf Finds usage of deprecated features
phpdoc-to-typehint Automatically adds type hints and return types based on PHPDocs
phpstan-localheinz-rules Additional rules for PHPstan
security-checker Checks composer dependencies for known security vulnerabilities
testability Analyses and reports testability issues of a php codebase

Running tools

Pull the image:

docker pull jakzal/phpqa

The default command will list available tools:

docker run -it --rm jakzal/phpqa

To run the selected tool inside the container, you'll need to mount the project directory on the container with -v "$(pwd):/project". Some tools like to write to the /tmp directory (like PHPStan, or Behat in some cases), therefore it's often useful to share it between docker runs, i.e. with -v "$(pwd)/tmp-phpqa:/tmp". If you want to be able to interrupt the selected tool if it takes too much time to complete, you can use the --init option. Please refer to the docker run documentation for more information.

docker run --init -it --rm -v "$(pwd):/project" -v "$(pwd)/tmp-phpqa:/tmp" -w /project jakzal/phpqa phpstan analyse src

You might want to tweak this command to your needs and create an alias for convenience:

alias phpqa='docker run --init -it --rm -v "$(pwd):/project" -v "$(pwd)/tmp-phpqa:/tmp" -w /project jakzal/phpqa:alpine'

Add it to your ~/.bashrc so it's defined every time you start a new terminal session.

Now the command becomes a lot simpler:

phpqa phpstan analyse src

Building the image

git clone https://github.com/jakzal/phpqa.git
cd phpqa
make build-debian

To build the alpine version:

make build-alpine

Cookbook

Please check out the cookbook for further tips & tricks.

Contributing

Please read the Contributing guide to learn about contributing to this project. Please note that this project is released with a Contributor Code of Conduct. By participating in this project you agree to abide by its terms.

entry.title: eitsupi/devcontainer-try-r
entry.summary:
This repository contains some example Dev Container definitions for R and can be run on GitHub Codespaces.

Try Out Development Containers: R

This repository contains some example Dev Container definitions for R and can be run on GitHub Codespaces (click on the badges!).

Dev Container Definitions

Combination of r-rig and rstudio-server

It is configured to install ghcr.io/rocker-org/devcontainer-features/r-rig and ghcr.io/rocker-org/devcontainer-features/rstudio-server on top of mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:ubuntu. Initially, the latest release version of R is installed, but rig makes it easy to install a different version of R and switch between these.

RStudio Server is configured to run immediately after container startup.

R (rocker/r-ver base) template

A simple template that runs a Docker image ghcr.io/rocker-org/devcontainer/r-ver configured to be used as a Dev Container. Many R packages are already installed.

It is just a download of the Dev Container Template ghcr.io/rocker-org/devcontainer-templates/r-ver.

R (r2u and bspm configured) template

It is configured to install ghcr.io/rocker-org/devcontainer-features/r-apt on top of mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:ubuntu. Installing many R packages quickly thanks to r2u.

It is just a download of the Dev Container Template ghcr.io/rocker-org/devcontainer-templates/r2u.
